slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचअभयं सत्त्वसंश‍ुद्धिर्ज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थिति: ।दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम् ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: “Lord Shri Krishna continued: Fearlessness, clean living, unceasing concentration on wisdom, readiness to give, self-control, a spirit of sacrifice, regular study of the scriptures, austerities, candour,

slokas: अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधस्त्याग: शान्तिरपैश‍ुनम् ।दया भूतेष्वलोलुप्‍त्वं मार्दवं ह्रीरचापलम् ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: harmlessness, truth, absence of wrath, renunciation, contentment, straightforwardness, compassion towards all, uncovetousness, courtesy, modesty, constancy,

slokas: तेज: क्षमा धृति: शौचमद्रोहो नातिमानिता ।भवन्ति सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातस्य भारत ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: Valour, forgiveness, fortitude, purity, freedom from hate and vanity; these are his who possesses the Godly Qualities, O Arjuna!

slokas: दम्भो दर्पोऽभिमानश्च क्रोध: पारुष्यमेव च ।अज्ञानं चाभिजातस्य पार्थ सम्पदमासुरीम् ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: Hypocrisy, pride, insolence, cruelty, ignorance belong to him who is born of the godless qualities.

slokas: दैवी सम्पद्विमोक्षाय निबन्धायासुरी मता ।मा श‍ुच: सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातोऽसि पाण्डव ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: Godly qualities lead to liberation; godless to bondage. Do not be anxious, Prince! You have the Godly qualities.

slokas: द्वौ भूतसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च ।दैवो विस्तरश: प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे श‍ृणु ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: All beings are of two classes: Godly and godless. The Godly I have described; I will now describe the other.

slokas: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जना न विदुरासुरा: ।न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: The godless do not know how to act or how to renounce. They have neither purity nor truth. They do not understand the right principles of conduct.

slokas: असत्यमप्रतिष्ठं ते जगदाहुरनीश्वरम् ।अपरस्परसम्भूतं किमन्यत्कामहैतुकम् ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: They say the universe is an accident with no purpose and no God. Life is created by sexual union, a product of lust and nothing else.

slokas: एतां दृष्टिमवष्टभ्य नष्टात्मानोऽल्पबुद्धय: ।प्रभवन्त्युग्रकर्माण: क्षयाय जगतोऽहिता: ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: Thinking thus, these degraded souls, these enemies of mankind – whose intelligence is negligible and whose deeds are monstrous – come into the world only to destroy.

slokas: काममाश्रित्य दुष्पूरं दम्भमानमदान्विता: ।मोहाद्‍गृहीत्वासद्‍ग्राहान्प्रवर्तन्तेऽश‍ुचिव्रता: ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: Giving themselves up to insatiable passions, hypocritical, self-sufficient and arrogant, cherishing false conception founded on delusion, they work only to carry out their own unholy purposes.

slokas: चिन्तामपरिमेयां च प्रलयान्तामुपाश्रिता: ।कामोपभोगपरमा एतावदिति निश्चिता: ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: Poring anxiously over evil resolutions, which only end in death; seeking only the gratification of desire as the highest goal; seeing nothing beyond;

slokas: आशापाशशतैर्बद्धा: कामक्रोधपरायणा: ।ईहन्ते कामभोगार्थमन्यायेनार्थसञ्चयान् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: Caught in the toils of a hundred vain hopes, the slaves of passion and wrath, they accumulate hoards of unjust wealth, only to pander to their sensual desire.

slokas: इदमद्य मया लब्धमिमं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम् ।इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम्  ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: This I have gained today; tomorrow I will gratify another desire; this wealth is mine now, the rest shall be mine before long;

slokas: असौ मया हत: शत्रुर्हनिष्ये चापरानपि ।ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: I have slain one enemy, I will slay the others also; I am worthy to enjoy, I am the Almighty, I am perfect, powerful and happy;

slokas: आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया ।यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्य इत्यज्ञानविमोहिता: ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: I am rich, I am well-bred; who is there to compare with me? I will sacrifice, I will give, I will pay – and I will enjoy. Thus blinded by Ignorance,

slokas: अनेकचित्तविभ्रान्ता मोहजालसमावृता: ।प्रसक्ता: कामभोगेषु पतन्ति नरकेऽश‍ुचौ ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: Perplexed by discordant thoughts, entangled in the snares of desire, infatuated by passion, they sink into the horrors of hell.

slokas: आत्मसम्भाविता: स्तब्धा धनमानमदान्विता: ।यजन्ते नामयज्ञैस्ते दम्भेनाविधिपूर्वकम् ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: Self-conceited, stubborn, rich, proud and insolent, they make a display of their patronage, disregarding the rules of decency.

slokas: अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिता: ।मामात्मपरदेहेषु प्रद्विषन्तोऽभ्यसूयका: ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: Puffed up by power and inordinate conceit, swayed by lust and wrath, these wicked people hate Me Who am within them, as I am within all.

slokas: तानहं द्विषत: क्रूरान्संसारेषु नराधमान् ।क्षिपाम्यजस्रमश‍ुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: Those who thus hate Me, who are cruel, the dregs of mankind, I condemn them to a continuous, miserable and godless rebirth.

slokas: आसुरीं योनिमापन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि ।मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेय ततो यान्त्यधमां गतिम् ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: So reborn, they spend life after life, enveloped in delusion. And they never reach Me, O Prince, but degenerate into still lower forms of life.

slokas: त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मन: ।काम: क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्‍त्रयं त्यजेत् ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: The gates of hell are three: lust, wrath and avarice. They destroy the Self. Avoid them.

slokas: एतैर्विमुक्त: कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नर: ।आचरत्यात्मन: श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: These are the gates which lead to darkness; if a man avoid them he will ensure his own welfare, and in the end will attain his liberation.

slokas: य: शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तते कामकारत: ।न स सिद्धिमवाप्‍नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम् ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: But he who neglects the commands of the scriptures, and follows the promptings of passion, he does not attain perfection, happiness or the final goal.

slokas: तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्यवस्थितौ ।ज्ञात्वा शास्त्रविधानोक्तं कर्म कर्तुमिहार्हसि ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: Therefore whenever there is doubt whether you should do a thing or not, let the scriptures guide your conduct. In the light of the scriptures should you labour the whole of your life.”
